Places.Name: Museo ng Caloocan
Places.Description: The official city museum, showcasing the history, cultural heritage, and contribution of Caloocan in the Philippine revolution, particularly the Cry of Caloocan.
Places.HoursNotice: Closed on Mondays and public holidays

Places.Name: Shrine of Our Lady of Grace Museum
Places.Description: A museum dedicated to the historical significance of the Our Lady of Grace Parish, housing religious artifacts and vestments dating back centuries.
Places.HoursDaily: Daily, 8:00 AM - 6:00 PM (Museum viewing may be limited)

Places.Name: Gomburza Shrine Museum
Places.Description: Although primarily a historical marker, this shrine and adjacent exhibit honor the martyred priests, Gomez, Burgos, and Zamora, offering insight into their lives and execution.
Places.HoursNotice: Subject to historical site operating procedures

Places.Name: La Consolacion College Caloocan Heritage Museum
Places.Description: Located within the college premises, this small museum preserves the educational and religious history of the Augustinian sisters and the school itself.
Places.HoursNotice: Visits must be scheduled in advance with the school administration.

Places.Name: Caloocan People's Park
Places.Description: A centrally located municipal park offering green space, pathways, and play areas for community recreation and relaxation.

Places.Name: Andres Bonifacio Monument Circle
Places.Description: A major historical landmark and traffic circle featuring the impressive monument to the Filipino revolutionary hero, Andres Bonifacio. It serves as an open public space.
Places.HoursNotice: Open to public; traffic circle access is limited to pedestrians at certain times.

Places.Name: Victory Central Mall Park Area
Places.Description: A small green space adjacent to Victory Central Mall, providing a shaded outdoor resting area amidst the commercial bustle.

Places.Name: Graceland Estates Mini Park
Places.Description: A neighborhood pocket park offering a quiet, manicured green space designed for local residents and casual visitors.

Places.Name: Sarao Jeepney Factory & Museum
Places.Description: A fascinating look into the iconic Philippine jeepney, offering insights into its history, design, and manufacturing process.
Places.HoursNotice: Tour availability may vary; prior booking is advised.

Activities.Name: Jeepney Factory Tour
Activities.Description: Witness the assembly process of a classic Philippine jeepney from start to finish and learn about its design history.

Activities.Name: Photo Ops with Iconic Jeepneys
Activities.Description: Take professional photos with restored, iconic Sarao Jeepney models in the museum area.

RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: Bamboo Organ Museum
Places.Description: Houses the world-famous Bamboo Organ, a unique 19th-century pipe organ made almost entirely of bamboo. The museum explores the organ's restoration and history.
Places.HoursNotice: Mass schedules may affect museum viewing hours.

Activities.Name: Organ Viewing Fee
Activities.Description: Mandatory fee for viewing and historical explanation of the Bamboo Organ inside the church.

Activities.Name: Concert Attendance
Activities.Description: Ticket price to attend one of the scheduled organ recitals or concerts. Price varies by event.

RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: Las Piñas City Museum
Places.Description: A repository of the city's local heritage, focusing on its transition from a fishing town to a suburban metropolis.
Places.HoursNotice: Located within the City Hall compound.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: Mary Immaculate Parish Eco-Museum
Places.Description: A small, environmentally-focused museum located within the 'Nature's Church,' emphasizing sustainable living and ecological conservation.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)
Places.Description: A globally important wetland and protected area that serves as a sanctuary for migratory birds and marine life. Excellent for bird watching and nature walks.
Places.HoursNotice: Pre-registration via DENR is strongly recommended.

Places.Name: Verdant Acres Park
Places.Description: A well-maintained community park with fitness equipment, pathways, and a children's playground, popular among local residents.

Places.Name: Villar Sipag Grounds
Places.Description: Part of the Villar SIPAG (Social Institute for Poverty Alleviation and Governance) complex, offering vast green lawns and event spaces.

Places.Name: C5 Extension Linear Park
Places.Description: A narrow park running alongside the C5 extension highway, providing jogging paths and basic recreation for nearby residents.

Places.Name: Ayala Museum
Places.Description: A premier museum in Makati's central business district, featuring four floors of exhibits covering Filipino history, art, and ethnology. Known for its historical dioramas.
Places.HoursNotice: Booking tickets online is highly recommended.

Activities.Name: Exhibit Access (Standard)
Activities.Description: Access to all permanent and rotating exhibitions for the day.

Activities.Name: Special Workshop Pass
Activities.Description: Discounted admission when bundled with special workshops or lecture programs.

Places.Name: Yuchengco Museum
Places.Description: Established by the Yuchengco Group of Companies, this museum focuses on Philippine culture, arts, and the personal collection of Ambassador Alfonso T. Yuchengco.
Places.HoursNotice: Closed on Sundays and major holidays.

Activities.Name: Gallery Admission
Activities.Description: Standard entrance to view all open galleries and exhibitions.

Activities.Name: Cultural Lecture Series
Activities.Description: Admission to specialized lectures on Filipino or international cultural topics.

Places.Name: Museo ng Makati
Places.Description: Located in a historic building, the city museum preserves and exhibits the rich heritage, history, and notable personalities of Makati.

Places.Name: RCBC Plaza Art Gallery
Places.Description: A corporate gallery space within the RCBC Plaza showcasing rotating exhibits of contemporary Philippine art and established masters.
Places.HoursNotice: Subject to building and exhibit schedules.

Places.Name: Ayala Triangle Gardens
Places.Description: A tranquil park and green oasis in the heart of the Makati Central Business District, popular for walking, jogging, and relaxation.

Places.Name: Washington SyCip Park
Places.Description: A serene and beautifully landscaped park featuring walking trails, benches, and a small Japanese garden. Perfect for quiet contemplation.

Places.Name: Legazpi Active Park
Places.Description: Known for its Sunday market, this park offers wide grassy areas, fitness corners, and a shaded environment for outdoor activities.

Places.Name: Jaime Velasquez Park (Salcedo Park)
Places.Description: Famous for its Saturday market, this park offers a charming public space with large, mature trees and pedestrian paths.

Places.Name: Museo de Malabon
Places.Description: The main cultural center of Malabon, preserving the city's unique culinary and architectural heritage, especially its famous ancestral homes.

Places.Name: Immaculate Conception Parish Museum
Places.Description: Located within one of Malabon's oldest churches, the museum showcases religious relics, historical documents, and vestments related to the parish's long history.

Places.Name: Malabon Heritage House
Places.Description: A well-preserved ancestral house that exemplifies the architectural style of the Spanish colonial era, often hosting temporary cultural exhibits.
Places.HoursNotice: Check local listings for specific tour availability.

Places.Name: Syquia House Replica Museum
Places.Description: A replica of the ancestral home of former President Elpidio Quirino's wife, which reflects the historical residential life of Manila's elite.
Places.HoursNotice: Check local historical society for information.

Places.Name: Malabon Zoo and Garden
Places.Description: A private zoo and tropical garden offering a collection of exotic animals, local wildlife, and spacious gardens for relaxation.
Places.HoursNotice: Private facility; check ahead for unexpected closures.

Activities.Name: Animal Feeding Session
Activities.Description: Participate in guided animal feeding sessions for specific zoo animals.

Activities.Name: Guided Garden Walk
Activities.Description: A guided tour of the tropical garden and local flora collection.

Places.Name: Concepcion Park
Places.Description: A well-known public park in the Concepcion area, featuring basketball courts, exercise facilities, and community gathering spots.

Places.Name: Dampalit Coastal Park
Places.Description: Located near the coast, this park provides views of Manila Bay and a space for relaxation away from the inland city centers.

Places.Name: Tañada Park
Places.Description: A small, quiet park named after Senator Lorenzo Tañada, offering a peaceful retreat and memorial area.

Places.Name: San Felipe Neri Church Museum
Places.Description: Dedicated to the history of San Felipe Neri Parish, one of the oldest in the region, housing religious artifacts, and historical vestments.

Places.Name: Mandaluyong City Museum
Places.Description: The repository of Mandaluyong's history, showcasing its growth from a small town to a dynamic city, often referred to as the 'Tiger City.'

Places.Name: Mandaluyong Art Center
Places.Description: A facility promoting local arts and culture, often hosting exhibitions of contemporary Filipino artists, focusing on regional talent.

Places.Name: Jose Rizal University Heritage Museum
Places.Description: A university museum showcasing the history of JRU and housing archival materials, including memorabilia related to the National Hero.
Places.HoursNotice: Visits require coordination with the university.

Places.Name: Mandaluyong City Hall Park
Places.Description: The public plaza in front of the city hall, featuring open spaces, historical markers, and often used for local government events.

Places.Name: Boni Park
Places.Description: A recreational park named after the primary thoroughfare, offering green patches, exercise equipment, and a local gathering spot for residents.

Places.Name: Hulo Park
Places.Description: A riverbank park located in Barangay Hulo, providing community leisure space along the Pasig River.

Places.Name: Wack Wack Green Park
Places.Description: A high-end residential park offering extensive, manicured green space, walking trails, and a quiet, exclusive atmosphere.

Places.Name: National Museum of Fine Arts
Places.Description: The premier art institution housing major Filipino artworks, including Juan Luna's Spoliarium. Focuses on classical, contemporary, and indigenous Philippine visual arts.
Places.HoursNotice: Booking online slots is highly recommended.

Places.Name: National Museum of Natural History
Places.Description: Focuses on Philippine flora and fauna, geology, and paleontology. It is famous for its centerpiece: the Tree of Life structure.
Places.HoursNotice: Booking online slots is highly recommended.

Places.Name: National Museum of Anthropology
Places.Description: Dedicated to the heritage of the Philippine people, housing collections on ethnology, archaeology, and the arts of ancient Filipinos.
Places.HoursNotice: Booking online slots is highly recommended.

Places.Name: Museo Pambata
Places.Description: A hands-on, interactive children's museum where kids can learn about science, culture, and history through play and exploration.

Activities.Name: Interactive Children's Exhibits
Activities.Description: Full access to all themed rooms and hands-on learning areas.

Activities.Name: Educational Workshops
Activities.Description: Participate in scheduled educational arts, crafts, or science workshops.

Places.Name: Rizal Park (Luneta)
Places.Description: A historic urban park and national memorial in the Philippines, considered one of the largest in Asia. Home to the Rizal Monument.

Places.Name: Manila Ocean Park
Places.Description: A major oceanarium and tourist attraction offering themed exhibits, marine shows, and interactive animal encounters.
Places.HoursNotice: Prices vary by package and season.

Activities.Name: Oceanarium Entrance
Activities.Description: Standard entrance to the main oceanarium and marine life exhibits.

Activities.Name: Animal Encounter Experience
Activities.Description: Interactive feeding or encounter sessions with sea creatures (add-on).

Places.Name: Intramuros
Places.Description: The historic walled city of Manila, featuring Spanish-era architecture, cobblestone streets, and key landmarks like Fort Santiago and San Agustin Church.
Places.PriceLabel: Entrance to Fort Santiago & attractions vary
Places.HoursNotice: Individual attraction fees apply inside the complex.
IncludedServices: General access to streets and parks

Activities.Name: Fort Santiago Entrance Fee
Activities.Description: Access to the main fort, Rizal Shrine, and dungeons.

Activities.Name: Bambike Ecotours
Activities.Description: Guided tours of Intramuros using bamboo bicycles (cruzades).

Places.Name: Manila Cathedral
Places.Description: A magnificent historical and religious landmark, the seat of the Archbishop of Manila and a symbol of faith and resilience.

Places.Name: Marikina Shoe Museum
Places.Description: Houses the infamous collection of shoes owned by former First Lady Imelda Marcos, alongside exhibits on the history of shoemaking in Marikina.

Places.Name: Marikina City Museum
Places.Description: The central repository for the city's historical artifacts, focusing on its colonial past, shoe industry, and local governance.
Places.HoursNotice: Located within the City Hall complex.

Places.Name: Kapitan Moy Heritage House Museum
Places.Description: A significant ancestral house where the first pair of shoes was made, now a museum and cultural venue for local arts and history.

Places.Name: Marikina Industrial Museum
Places.Description: A specialized museum documenting the industrial and manufacturing evolution of Marikina, going beyond just the shoe industry.
Places.HoursNotice: May be temporarily closed; check before visiting.

Places.Name: Marikina River Park
Places.Description: A sprawling linear park running along the Marikina River, offering vast recreational areas, sports facilities, and festival grounds.

Places.Name: Lilac Street Park
Places.Description: A local neighborhood park located near the food strip, offering a small, comfortable spot for relaxation and outdoor meals.

Places.Name: Freedom Park (City Hall)
Places.Description: The civic plaza located directly in front of the Marikina City Hall, known for its large statue and open space for public gatherings.

Places.Name: Marikina Sports Center Park
Places.Description: The surrounding grounds of the main sports complex, offering jogging paths, exercise areas, and public recreation space.

Places.Name: Museo ng Muntinlupa
Places.Description: A modern museum dedicated to the city's history, culture, and achievements, with a focus on its transformation from a rural town.

Places.Name: JETOUR Auto Museum
Places.Description: A specialized museum/showroom dedicated to the history and evolution of modern automotive technology, focusing on the Jetour brand.

Activities.Name: View Classic and Modern Vehicles
Activities.Description: Access to the exclusive classic car exhibit area and the newest models.

Activities.Name: Automotive History Presentation
Activities.Description: A guided multimedia presentation on the history of the automotive industry.

Places.Name: Alabang Town Center Exhibit Hall
Places.Description: A rotating exhibit space within the mall, often featuring local artists, historical photos, or community-focused displays.

Places.Name: New Bilibid Prison Museum
Places.Description: A historical museum within the national penitentiary, focusing on the history of the prison, famous inmates, and the correctional system.
Places.HoursNotice: Strict security protocols. Tours must be arranged in advance.

Places.Name: Filinvest City Central Park
Places.Description: A spacious, modern urban park in the Filinvest City complex, designed for jogging, walking, and community events.

Places.Name: Alabang Country Club Park
Places.Description: The expansive grounds surrounding the Alabang Country Club, offering high-end sports and leisure facilities (access restricted to members and guests).
Places.HoursNotice: Strictly for members and endorsed guests.

Places.Name: Cupang Wetland Park
Places.Description: A local ecological park focusing on wetland conservation and serving as a bird habitat and passive recreation area.

Places.Name: Jamboree Lake Park
Places.Description: Located within the New Bilibid Prison Reservation, this historical lake area offers a spacious, quiet park setting (access is restricted).
Places.HoursNotice: Access requires coordination with the BuCor/local officials.

Places.Name: Museo ng Navotas
Places.Description: The city's official museum, dedicated to the rich maritime and fishing heritage of Navotas, often called the 'Fishing Capital of the Philippines'.

Places.Name: Navotas Centennial Exhibit
Places.Description: A permanent exhibit celebrating the city's milestones and history, often focused on its transformation over the past century.
Places.HoursNotice: Located within the City Hall complex.

Places.Name: St. Francis of Assisi Parish Museum
Places.Description: A small parish museum focusing on religious art, artifacts, and vestments relevant to the history of the Navotas community.

Places.Name: Navotas Fishing Heritage Center
Places.Description: A venue dedicated to showcasing traditional fishing methods, tools, and the vital economic role of the fishing industry in Navotas.
Places.HoursNotice: Check city tourism office for operating details.

Places.Name: Navotas Centennial Park
Places.Description: A large public park built to commemorate Navotas' centennial, offering open spaces, play areas, and a civic plaza.

Places.Name: R-10 Baywalk Park
Places.Description: A long coastal stretch along the R-10 road offering seaside views, jogging, biking lanes, and a popular spot for sunset viewing.

Places.Name: San Roque Coastal Park
Places.Description: A small coastal park primarily used by the local community for relaxation and a view of the fishing port activities.

Places.Name: Daanghari Coastal Park
Places.Description: Located along the Daanghari area, this is another small, community-focused coastal recreational space.

Places.Name: Baclaran Church Museum
Places.Description: Located within the National Shrine of Our Mother of Perpetual Help, this museum houses various religious relics and art pieces donated over the shrine's history.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: Parañaque Heritage Museum
Places.Description: The city's historical repository, focusing on its colonial history, role as a trading post, and cultural evolution.
Places.HoursNotice: Located within the City Hall complex.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: Air Force Museum (Villamor)
Places.Description: Located near Villamor Air Base, this museum preserves the history of the Philippine Air Force, showcasing vintage aircraft, uniforms, and historical artifacts.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: Mary Help of Christians Parish Mini Museum
Places.Description: A small, local museum focusing on the history and spiritual heritage of the Mary Help of Christians Parish and the Salesian community.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: Parañaque Community Park
Places.Description: A centralized park providing ample space for community gatherings, fitness, and relaxation in the heart of the city.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: BF Homes Park
Places.Description: A series of small, interconnected pocket parks within the massive BF Homes subdivision, catering to local residents' recreational needs.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: Elizalde Park
Places.Description: A historical and residential park area providing a large, established green space with mature trees and a tranquil environment.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: San Dionisio Park
Places.Description: A local park in the San Dionisio area, serving as a primary recreational and event venue for the barangay.
RecommendedPlaces: Las Piñas–Parañaque Critical Habitat and Ecotourism Area (LPPCHEA)

Places.Name: GSIS Museum of Art
Places.Description: Located within the GSIS complex, this museum features a vast collection of contemporary and historical Philippine art from renowned Filipino artists.

Places.Name: Museo ni Apolinario Mabini
Places.Description: A historical house and museum dedicated to the life and legacy of Apolinario Mabini, known as the 'Brains of the Revolution'.
Places.HoursNotice: Part of the National Historical Commission.

Places.Name: Philippine Air Force Aerospace Museum
Places.Description: Showcases a wide collection of vintage and modern Philippine Air Force aircraft, artifacts, and military history.

Places.Name: Upside Down Museum
Places.Description: A unique, interactive museum featuring over 20 upside-down and illusion-based exhibits designed for fun and photography.
Places.HoursNotice: Check website for latest schedule and ticket prices.

Activities.Name: Upside-Down Illusion Photos
Activities.Description: Full access to all themed rooms for unique, gravity-defying photography sessions.

Activities.Name: Creative Themed Rooms Access
Activities.Description: Explore creative and themed rooms for interactive, Instagram-worthy experiences.

Places.Name: CCP Complex Park
Places.Description: The expansive grounds surrounding the Cultural Center of the Philippines, offering vast open spaces, art installations, and bayside walking paths.

Places.Name: Cartimar Green Park
Places.Description: A small green area located near the commercial center, providing a relaxing rest stop amidst shopping and transit activity.

Places.Name: Libertad Park
Places.Description: A local community park in the Libertad area, serving as a neighborhood gathering point and children's play area.

Places.Name: Blue Bay Walk Park
Places.Description: An aesthetically pleasing park and promenade area along Manila Bay, part of the Blue Bay Walk retail complex, popular for evening strolls.

Places.Name: Pasig City Museum
Places.Description: Housed in the old Pasig Municipal Hall (a historical landmark), the museum chronicles the city's rich history, from pre-colonial times to the present.

Places.Name: Lopez Museum and Library
Places.Description: A privately owned institution dedicated to the preservation of Filipino art and historical documents, including pre-colonial pieces and modern works.
Places.HoursNotice: Check official site for current exhibit and entrance fees.

Activities.Name: Filipiniana Collection Viewing
Activities.Description: Access to the main museum galleries and rare Filipiniana archives and manuscripts.

Activities.Name: Cultural Lecture Access
Activities.Description: Admission to specialized cultural lectures and exhibit talks (requires separate booking).

Places.Name: Museo de Santa Rosa de Lima
Places.Description: A parish museum showcasing the religious history and artifacts of the Santa Rosa de Lima Parish, one of the oldest in the area.

Places.Name: San Agustin Parish Mini Museum
Places.Description: A small exhibition space within the San Agustin Parish focused on the religious and community history of Pasig's old town.

Places.Name: Rainforest Adventure Park (RAVE)
Places.Description: A large ecological and recreational complex featuring a zoo, fitness facilities, a park, and various adventure activities.
Places.HoursNotice: Additional fees apply for specific attractions.

Activities.Name: Fishing at Designated Areas
Activities.Description: Access to the fishing lagoon. Pay per catch rules may apply.

Activities.Name: Picnic and Camping Facilities
Activities.Description: Rental fee for designated picnic tables or camping spots.

Places.Name: Pasig City Park
Places.Description: A large central park providing vast lawns, a children's playground, and designated areas for community events and relaxation.

Places.Name: Tiendesitas Park
Places.Description: A small green space surrounding the Tiendesitas commercial complex, offering a themed outdoor area for rest and relaxation.

Places.Name: Kapitolyo Linear Park
Places.Description: A long, narrow park running through the Kapitolyo neighborhood, popular for jogging and community gatherings.

Places.Name: Quezon City Experience (QCX)
Places.Description: A modern, interactive social history museum chronicling the journey and identity of Quezon City, featuring multimedia exhibits.

Activities.Name: Interactive QC History Exhibits
Activities.Description: Access to all multimedia and interactive displays about the history of Quezon City.

Activities.Name: Virtual Reality Experiences
Activities.Description: Fee for using the virtual reality exhibit stations.

RecommendedPlaces: Ninoy Aquino Parks and Wildlife Center

Places.Name: Art in Island Museum
Places.Description: One of Asia's largest 3D art museums, featuring various interactive murals and trick-eye paintings that create unique photo opportunities.
Places.HoursNotice: Check official site for current prices and schedules.

Activities.Name: 3D Interactive Art Installations
Activities.Description: Full access to the 3D exhibition floors and special effect areas.

Activities.Name: Creative Photo Sessions
Activities.Description: Free use of tripods and guidance for creative photo opportunities.

RecommendedPlaces: Ninoy Aquino Parks and Wildlife Center

Places.Name: UP Vargas Museum
Places.Description: The oldest university museum in the Philippines, located within UP Diliman, housing a significant collection of Philippine art, historical documents, and personal memorabilia of Jorge B. Vargas.

Activities.Name: Standard Museum Entrance
Activities.Description: Access to permanent and rotating exhibitions within the museum.

Activities.Name: Art Workshop Attendance
Activities.Description: Discounted fee for students/faculty attending a specific art workshop or seminar.

RecommendedPlaces: Ninoy Aquino Parks and Wildlife Center

Places.Name: Presidential Car Museum
Places.Description: A specialized museum under the National Historical Commission, housing a collection of official state vehicles used by former Philippine Presidents.
RecommendedPlaces: Ninoy Aquino Parks and Wildlife Center

Places.Name: Quezon Memorial Circle
Places.Description: A national park and shrine, famous for the towering monument to President Manuel L. Quezon. It features vast open spaces, a biking loop, and various recreation centers.
RecommendedPlaces: Ninoy Aquino Parks and Wildlife Center

Places.Name: Ninoy Aquino Parks and Wildlife Center
Places.Description: A major urban park and zoological facility managed by the DENR, housing a rescue center, a lagoon, and diverse flora and fauna.

Activities.Name: Wildlife Viewing and Bird Watching
Activities.Description: Standard entrance fee covers access to all park areas, including the lagoon and bird-watching spots.

Activities.Name: Boating and Fishing Activities
Activities.Description: Fees apply for boat rentals or fishing gear rentals at the lagoon.

Places.Name: La Mesa Ecopark
Places.Description: A large ecological park and watershed area, providing a green refuge and serving various recreational and conservation purposes. Excellent for hiking and biking.

Activities.Name: Fishing at the Reservoir
Activities.Description: Daily fee for fishing access and rental of basic gear.

Activities.Name: Swimming Pool Access
Activities.Description: Fee for swimming pool and water activity access.

Activities.Name: Biking/Camping/Picnicking
Activities.Description: Fees for specific activity areas or equipment rental.

RecommendedPlaces: Ninoy Aquino Parks and Wildlife Center

Places.Name: UP Sunken Garden
Places.Description: The massive central lawn of the University of the Philippines Diliman campus, famous for student activities, concerts, and fitness. A true civic space.
RecommendedPlaces: Ninoy Aquino Parks and Wildlife Center

Places.Name: Museo ng Katipunan
Places.Description: Dedicated to the Katipunan revolutionary society, showcasing artifacts and documents related to Andres Bonifacio and the Philippine struggle for independence.

Places.Name: Pinaglabanan Memorial Shrine Museum
Places.Description: The historical site of the first battle of the Katipunan, featuring a museum that details the events and heroes of the Philippine Revolution.

Places.Name: Greenhills Museum
Places.Description: A small museum or exhibit area within the Greenhills complex, often focusing on history or art related to the area.
Places.HoursNotice: Follows mall operating hours. Access may vary.

Places.Name: Santuario del Santo Cristo Heritage Museum
Places.Description: Located within the historic Sanctuario del Santo Cristo, the museum preserves religious artifacts and the history of the Dominican Order in the Philippines.

Places.Name: Pinaglabanan Shrine Park
Places.Description: The historical park surrounding the Pinaglabanan Memorial Shrine, featuring large open lawns, walking paths, and the monument itself.

Places.Name: San Juan Mini Park
Places.Description: A small, local park serving as a central meeting place and recreational spot for the surrounding community.

Places.Name: Greenhills Garden Park
Places.Description: The green spaces and walking paths within the Greenhills Shopping Center complex, providing a brief respite from shopping.

Places.Name: Ortigas Avenue Linear Park
Places.Description: A long, narrow park running alongside a busy thoroughfare, utilized for jogging, cycling, and exercise.

Places.Name: The Mind Museum
Places.Description: A world-class science museum in Bonifacio Global City, offering five main galleries covering the atom, earth, life, universe, and technology, with interactive exhibits.
Places.HoursNotice: Closed on Mondays. Ticket booking advised.

Activities.Name: Interactive Science Exhibits
Activities.Description: Standard fee for full access to all five themed galleries and exhibit floors.

Activities.Name: Planetarium Shows
Activities.Description: Fee for dedicated Planetarium shows and educational demonstrations.

Places.Name: Veterans Museum (Libingan ng mga Bayani)
Places.Description: Located within the Libingan ng mga Bayani (Heroes' Cemetery), this museum honors Filipino soldiers and war heroes, housing military artifacts and historical photos.

Places.Name: Taguig City Museum
Places.Description: The city's main historical and cultural museum, focusing on the development of Taguig from a lakeside community to a modern urban center.
Places.HoursNotice: Located within the City Hall complex.

Places.Name: SM Aura Art Gallery
Places.Description: A rotating art space within the SM Aura Premier mall showcasing works by contemporary Filipino artists and often hosting cultural events.
Places.HoursNotice: Follows mall operating hours. Access may vary.

Places.Name: Bonifacio High Street Park
Places.Description: A series of linear parks integrated into the Bonifacio High Street retail area, providing green spaces, public art, and seating.

Places.Name: Terra 28th Park
Places.Description: A BGC park designed for outdoor play and traditional Filipino games, featuring modern play equipment and open lawns.

Places.Name: Track 30th Park
Places.Description: A linear park in BGC focusing on fitness, featuring a jogging track, yoga lawn, and fitness art installations.

Places.Name: Kasalikasan Garden Park
Places.Description: A hidden, amphitheater-like garden nestled within BGC, offering a quiet, shaded retreat for reflection and small events.

Places.Name: Museo Valenzuela
Places.Description: The city's official history museum, preserving the cultural and political heritage of Valenzuela, named after Dr. Pio Valenzuela.

Places.Name: Dr. Pio Valenzuela House
Places.Description: The ancestral house of the city's namesake, Dr. Pio Valenzuela, a significant figure in the Katipunan, preserved as a historical shrine.

Places.Name: Museo ng Pamana
Places.Description: A museum dedicated to the concept of heritage and legacy, often featuring temporary exhibits on local arts, crafts, and culture.
Places.HoursNotice: Check city tourism office for current exhibit.

Places.Name: Valenzuela Heritage Museum
Places.Description: An alternative venue for historical and cultural preservation, focusing on specific eras of the city's development.
Places.HoursNotice: Visits must be arranged in advance.

Places.Name: Polo Park
Places.Description: A large public park in the Polo area, known for its open spaces, playgrounds, and community sports facilities.

Places.Name: People's Park Valenzuela
Places.Description: The city's main civic park and plaza, featuring large open lawns, a water fountain display, and public art installations.

Places.Name: Disiplina Village Park
Places.Description: A recreational area built within the Disiplina Village housing complex, focused on providing green space and sports facilities for residents.

Places.Name: Wawang Pulo Park
Places.Description: A small park located in the Wawang Pulo area, offering a quiet, localized green space for community use.
